title: article-5 Today's obesity epidemic may have been caused by childhood sugar intake decades ago
description: A short description of the post. throughout this article researchers from the University of TENNESSEE have conducted a study on the timeliness of the time lag between the increase in sugar consumption in childhood and the increase in current obesity rates

title: article-4 GUT-BRAIN CONNECTION HELPS EXPLAIN HOW OVEREATING LEADS TO OBESITY
description: researchers wanted to understand the interactions that explain weight gain leading to obesity following a high-fat diet.

title: Article_3:SHIPMENT TRACKING FOR 'FAT PARCELS' IN THE BODY
description:
A short description of the post.
"Fat packages that researchers have coupled to alkyl groups (acting as markers) and sent to liver cells of mice to monitor the evolution of these packages during fat metabolism"

title: Article 2 : Molecule Links Weight Gain To Gut Bacteria
description:
A short description of the post.
"commensal microbes that program the circadian rhythms of an organism would promote the absorption of nutrients in general and fats in particular by activating a protein called histone deacetylase 3 (HDAC3)"

title: Article 1 : Clinical Trial Shows Alternate-Day Fasting A Safe Alternative To Caloric Restriction
description:
A short description of the post.
"ADF is a promising experimental method because it allows the reduction of calories but much remains to be done to perfect it"
